channel.title: Alex Hedley
channel.description: Welcome to my Symantec Connect Articles!

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Restart Workflow Services
item.description: The 'Restart Workflow Services' plugin will restart the Workflow Service (swfsvr) as your user account.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Restart Workflow Services

The 'Restart Workflow Services' plugin will restart the Workflow Service (swfsvr) as your user account.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Workflow Service (swfsvr) will be restarted using the currently logged in user.

Alternative

Open 'Task Tray Tool' - Start | All Programs | Symantec | Workflow Designer | Tools
("[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Tools\LogicBase.Local.TaskTray.exe")

Restart Server Extensions

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

net stop swfsvr
net start swfsvr

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Workflow Logs Folder
item.description: The 'Open Workflow Logs Folder' gets the install folder of Workflow and opens the Logs folder in Explorer.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Open Workflow Logs Folder

The 'Open Workflow Logs Folder' gets the install folder of Workflow and opens the Logs folder in Explorer.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Opens the Workflow Logs Folder.

Alternative

Open Explorer and navigate to '[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Logs'

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Workflow Explorer
item.description: The 'Workflow Explorer (Running As)' checks if Workflow Explorer is running and who has it open (the owner).
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Workflow Explorer (Running As)

The 'Workflow Explorer (Running As)' checks if Workflow Explorer is running and who has it open (the owner).

This is handy because it can only be open on one machine but gives no indiciation if it doesn't open, you can then contact the user to close it.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Domain\Username or 

Alternative

Ctrl + Shift + Esc to open Windows Task Manager.

Click the "Processes" tab.

Tick ☑ "Show processes from all users"

Search for the Workflow Explorer (Symantec.Explorer.exe) and check the Process Owner.

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Powershell
item.description: The 'Powershell' plugin opens a file picker, filters on Powershell file extensions (**.ps1*, *.psm1, *.psd1) and then runs the chosen file with custom param ($project) that can be used in your Powershell script.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Powershell

The 'Powershell' plugin opens a file picker, filters on Powershell file extensions (**.ps1*, *.psm1, *.psd1) and then runs the chosen file with custom param ($project) that can be used in your Powershell script.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Choose a Powershell file to run, you can chose whether to hide the powershell dialog.

This runs with a param of the Project Directory "-project"

So you can add the following to your powershell scripts to access this path.

param([String]$project="")
...
write-output $project

Alternative

Start | All Programs | Accessories | Windows PowerShell

%SystemRoot%\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

powershell.exe -file "FILENAME"

Or

powershell.exe -file "" -project ""

Or

powershell.exe -windowstyle Hidden -file "" -project ""

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

Documentation

[Display any related Documentation]

    • Chapter/Page #

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus
item.description: Symantec  Workflow Manager has a number of Plugins available from install.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Symantec  Workflow Manager has a number of Plugins available from install.

These are documented: Workflow Plugins.

You can download a copy from the following Connect post:

Download Protirus.Workflow.Plugins

I've created a bundle which are listed below, 'Model Info' down,

Each will be explained on their own pages.

  • Model Info

  • Recycle App Pools

  • Restart IIS

  • Restart Workflow Services

  • Powershell

  • Task Tray Tool

  • Workflow Explorer (Running As)

  • Open Workflow Logs Folder

  • Zip Project

  • Protirus

    • This was just to test some basic info about a Project, get it's Icon etc

There are some config options to allow customisation.

Included will be an XML file :

Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml

Save this to the Plugins directory

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins

This currently has two sections, one to choose whether to show or hide each plugin in the menu. This is so you only need to have one DLL instead of individual but means you don't have to have a huge list showing.

  <plugins>
    <pluginsDef>
      <name>ModelInfoPlugin</name>
      <show>true</show>
    </pluginsDef>
  ...
  </plugins>

Swap <show>true</show> to <show>false</show> if you wish to not see them.

The second section is specifically for the Zip plugin, it sets which Log files will be included, by default, in the list.

  <files>
    <filesDef>
      <name>processmanager.log</name>
      <show>true</show>
    </filesDef>
  ...
  </files>

Swap <show>true</show> to <show>false</show> if you wish to not see them in the list, you can always manually add them.

I'm also using a NuGet package "DotNetZip", within the Zip Plugin to perform the zip of the Project / Log, this DLL (and XML) will also need to be included in the Plugins directory.

  • DotNetZip.dll
  • DotNetZip.xml

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Task Tray Tool
item.description: The 'Task Tray Tool' plugin opens the Task Tray Tool app so the icon shows in the Task Tray ready for use, it was added to make it easier to find.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Task Tray Tool

The 'Task Tray Tool' plugin opens the Task Tray Tool app so the icon shows in the Task Tray ready for use, it was added to make it easier to find.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Opens the Task Tray Tool App in the Task Tray

Alternative

Start | All Programs | Symantec | Workflow Designer | Tools | Task Tray Tool

"[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Tools\LogicBase.Local.TaskTray.exe"

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Recycle App Pools
item.description: The 'Recycle App Pools' plugin allow you to Recycle a chosen App Pool via a Form.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Recycle App Pools

The 'Recycle App Pools' plugin allow you to Recycle a chosen App Pool via a Form.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

A Form is displayed with a list of App Pools, clicking on an App Pool will display the Applications within it.

You can Recycle a chose App Pool and check on it's current Status.

You can also open IIS.

Alternative

Open IIS Manager (Start | Administrative Tools | Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager)

%windir%\system32\inetsrv\InetMgr.exe

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Model Info
item.description: The Model Info plugin displays a list of all Models within the current Project. When you select a given Model a list of Components are displayed, showing their Id, Name and Description.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Model Info

The Model Info plugin displays a list of all Models within the current Project. When you select a given Model a list of Components are displayed, showing their Id, Name and Description.

You can then Filter on a given Field.

This allows you to search for a Guid that maybe in Logs you are diagnosing.

Plugin Icon

Author

![Protirus 0](images\Protirus 0.png) Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

A Form opens which lists all the Models in the project and selecting a model displays a list of Components (with Guids) to search on.

Alternative

See Article by Sam

Workflow - Finding a model name using the model GUID
https://www.symantec.com/connect/articles/workflow-finding-model-name-using-model-guid

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml file.

Documentation

[Display any related Documentation]

  • Title URL
    • Chapter/Page #

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Restart IIS
item.description: The 'Restart IIS' plugin will restart IIS on the Workflow box using the currently logged in user..
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Restart IIS

The 'Restart IIS' plugin will restart IIS on the Workflow box using the currently logged in user..

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

IIS will be restarted using the currently logged in user.

Alternative

Open IIS Manager (Start | Administrative Tools | Internet Information Services (IIS) Manager)

%windir%\system32\inetsrv\InetMgr.exe

iisreset

Process.Start("net", "stop w3svc"); //net stop IISADMIN
Process.Start("net", "start w3svc"); //net start IISADMIN

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

  • Title URL
    • Chapter/Page #

item.title: Workflow - Plugins - Protirus - Zip
item.description: The 'Zip' Plugin has been produced to match similar functionality as the Altiris Log Viewer which also has a Zip function.
item.author: AlexHedley
item.content:encoded:
Zip

The 'Zip' Plugin has been produced to match similar functionality as the Altiris Log Viewer which also has a Zip function.

The 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' has a <files> section that can be configured to display which Log files will show by default. These can then be chosen and added to the package that is zipped.

Plugin Icon

Author

 Protirus (Alex Hedley)

Perform Action

Open a Form that allows for Folder/File selection and then a Zip action to bundle the files to given directory.

Update the file with the ones you wish to show.

<files>
    <filesDef>
      <name>processmanager.log</name>
      <show>true</show>
    </filesDef>
  ...
</files>

Alternative

Manually find the files and compress yourself.

Location

[Install Drive]:\Program Files\Symantec\Workflow\Designer\Plugins\

DLL

  • Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.dll

Code

N/A

Customise

Can be hidden with a config change in the 'Protirus.Workflow.Plugins.xml' file.

Documentation

[Display any related Documentation]

    • Chapter/Page #
